required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Occurrence of Adverse Effects With Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors Between a Single and Double Dose Regimen
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Occurrence of Adverse Effects With Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors Between a Single and Double Dose Regimen

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a retrospective evaluation of the impact of a double dose regimen of immunotherapy use in cancer treatment compared to the single-dose regimen on the occurrence of clinically significant adverse events.
The aim of this study is to provide evidence-based arguments to help clinicians to propose the best treatment regimen for each patient.

primary_outcome.measure: To compare the incidence of clinical significant toxicities
primary_outcome.description: To compare the incidence of clinical significant toxicities reported for patients treated with a cancer immunotherapy on a simple dose regiment versus double dose regimen

secondary_outcome.description: To describe the incidence, type and severity of overall toxicities (serious and non-serious) reported with single and double dose cancer immunotherapy regimens

secondary_outcome.measure: To identify risk factors for the development of severe toxicity
secondary_outcome.description: To identify risk factors for the development of severe toxicity

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the management and evolution of toxicities
secondary_outcome.description: To describe the management and evolution of toxicities

secondary_outcome.measure: To describe the clinical oncologic response
secondary_outcome.description: To describe the clinical oncologic response

study_pop.textblock: Any adult patient (over the age of 18) from Montpellier University Hospital or Montpellier Cancer Institute who has initiated an immunotherapy between 01/01/2019 and 31/12/2020 with anti-PD-1 or PD-L-1 immune checkpoint inhibitor as monotherapy (nivolumab, pembrolizumab, atezolizumab, durvalumab, avelumab)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Any adult patient with anti-PD-1 or PD-L-1 immune checkpoint inhibitor as monotherapy
Exclusion criteria:
- age < 18
